column.name: PRODUCT_SUBSCRIPTION_ID
column.comment: This attribute uniquely identifies the Product Subscription.

column.name: EFFECTIVE_DATE
column.comment: This column stores the date the current Product Subscription becomes effective.

column.name: CHANGE_TYPE
column.comment: Data warehouse entry last action type: "I"-Inserted, "U"-Updated, "D"-Deleted.

column.name: LOADTM
column.comment: Data warehouse entry change date timestamp (Original name in the DWHDB "_LOADTM")

column.name: EFFECTIVE_FLAG
column.comment: Flagging of entries according to EFFECTIVE_DATE maintained by source system (EFFONL). "N" (now) - currently valid entry, "P" (past) - entry that was valid some then in the past, "F" (future) - entity will be valid in the future.

column.name: EFFECTIVE_STATUS
column.comment: This attribute holds the Product Subscription`s current status. e.g ACTIVE, DEACTIVE

column.name: CUSTOMER_NUMBER
column.comment: The Customer Number logical foreign key of the Customer associated to the Product Subscription.

column.name: PRODUCT_COMMITMENT_NUMBER
column.comment: The unique identifier for an associated Product Commitment. This is a logical foreign key to Product Commitment.

column.name: STATE_RD
column.comment: This attribute defines the the current state of the Product Subscription.

column.name: STATE_DATE
column.comment: The State Date is the last date that the state of the Product Subscription has been modified.

column.name: PRICE_PLAN_STATE_RD
column.comment: The Price Plan State is used in the Apply New Pricing Structure scenario to define the state of the Price Plan Subscriptions associated to the Product Subscription.

column.name: PRODUCT_GROUP_RD
column.comment: Product group of the product subscription

column.name: AUDIT_UPDATE_USER_ID
column.comment: Audit information capturing user id of last update

column.name: AUDIT_UPDATE_DATE_TIME
column.comment: Audit information capturing date and time of last update

column.name: UPDATE_NUMBER
column.comment: Version number of the row. The version number starts with a random number and is incremented on each update. Update and Delete operations verify that the number in the database is equal to the number used in the SQL statement (optimistic locking).

column.name: PRODUCT_CHANGE_REQ_INDICATOR
column.comment: This fields states whether the Product Subscription requires a Swap Product action to be performed, or whether one has already been perfor med.

column.name: EFFECTIVE_DATE_HW
column.comment: This column stores the date the current row becomes effective.

column.name: APPLY_SWAP_DATE
column.comment: Date on which tariff is changed

column.name: PRODUCT_SUBSCRIPTION_GROUP_ID
column.comment: The id for the related product subscription group

column.name: APPLY_TRANS_ID
column.comment: N/A

column.name: VIS_TRACKING_POSITION
column.comment: VIS tracking position value

column.name: FILLER
column.comment: N/A
